node.title: 'It makes me sick to drive across it': Outback creek renamed
node.alt: A brown body of water snakes through an outback landscape
node.description: An outback council will work with the state government to change the 'racist' name of a creek, but Indigenous elders say there areÂ dozens more just like it across the state.
node.content:
["Kerry Thompson feels uneasy when she drives across Black Gin Creek\u00a0near Longreach in outback Queensland.\u00a0", "\"I've lived out here my whole life and I travel across that creek in my work on a regular basis,\" she said.", "\"It just makes me sick to drive across it, to think of that name.", "\"I can confidently say that these names have been offensive and derogatory to all Indigenous and Torres Strait Islander people\u00a0and not just a few.\"", "Last week, Longreach Regional Council signed off on an application to change the name to Watyakan Creek \u2014\u00a0Women's Creek \u2014\u00a0which pays tribute to those who historically camped near it.", "", "
Barcaldine local Kerry Thompson says changing racist place names is a step towards reconciliation.(Supplied: Aaron Skinn)
", "University of Queensland Indigenous language fellow Des Crump, who was involved in coming up with the new title, said the current name was derogatory to Aboriginal women.", "\"So it's very encouraging that the Longreach council have taken that step to do something about it and hopefully it encourages other councils to reconsider some of those name changes,\" he said.", "", "
Indigenous language consultant Des Crump says he hopes other councils follow suit and change racist place names.(ABC News: Phoebe Hosier)
", "Ms Thompson said changing the name would be a \"step towards reconciliation\".", "\"If we want to close out racism in our country\u00a0these are the things that we need to be looking at as well,\" she said.", "
One of many
", "Darumbal elder Aunty Sally Vea Vea said there were still dozens of racist place names across the state that needed changing, including \"at least\" 26 Black Gin Creeks and Black Fella Creeks.", "Western Queensland is also home to Native Companion Creek, east of Alpha, Chinaman Creek near Longreach, and Skull Hole in Blandensberg National Park.", "", "
Darumbal elder Aunty Sally Vea Vea wants to see racist place names changed in bulk.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "Aunty Sally and her supporters have been successful in changing several place names in central Queensland.", "\"I'd just like to see it all changed in bulk.", "\"That's what I did ask in the first place \u2014\u00a0to have them all changed.", "\"But [the Department of Resources] told me I could only change the one on Darumbal country.", "\"They told me that it would be up to each traditional owner group to apply, so we all have to go through that process and get it done.\"", "", "
Longreach Regional Council mayor Tony Rayner says council will work with the state government to change the creek name.(ABC Western Qld: Craig Fitzsimmons)
", "Longreach Mayor Tony Rayner said he was very pleased with the impending\u00a0name change for Black Gin Creek, which was \"a little bit offensive for some\".", "But he did not anticipate any other name changes in the district, which included\u00a0Chinaman Creek.", "\"It would depend on whether anyone was offended by that,\" Cr Rayner said.", "\"But I think you have to be reasonable \u2014\u00a0that one probably wouldn't be offensive to many people. It is a little bit subject to interpretation.", "\"If there's a genuine business case that's stated, we'd certainly consider it, but we're not expecting that there would\u00a0be other name changes.\"", "", "
Chinaman Creek on the Landsborough Highway between Longreach and Ilfracombe.(ABC Western Qld: Craig Fitzsimmons)
", "Aunty Sally said many traditional owners across Queensland were working through native title and other processes, so place names were not prioritised.", "\"There shouldn't have to be all these reasons of why we do it, it's just that all the names are very dehumanising,\" she said.", "\"Each traditional group can have a say on what the name is.\"", "For Ms Thompson, the name change at the creek in the Longreach Shire will give her peace of mind.", "\"I'll have a different perspective on it when I see that name change,\" she said.", "\"[It'll] make me proud to be an Aboriginal woman going across there and looking down, seeing those people either collecting water, sitting around talking women's business.\""]
